intro: Ageratina kochiana, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces fluffy, white to pale blue flower clusters that resemble mist. Ageratina kochiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
